key_channel_insights.line_content: 80 % of OTA itineraries match the website price, but 18 % of offers—half of all long-haul—are simply missing, capping revenue potential despite solid pricing control.
Undercuts have fallen to 13.7 % of MSE searches, yet each still averages a 14–15 % fare drop, disproportionately hurting close-in, high-yield bookings.
GDS parity is strongest of all channels (81 %), but when higher it spikes to +24 % on close-in inventory, and nearly half of long-haul O&Ds remain unavailable.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 80 % of OTA fares are identical to JetBlue.com and have remained flat week-on-week and month-on-month.
50 % of long-haul O&Ds are not offered on OTAs—17× the short-haul rate—unchanged in the past month.
Undercuts and premiums each sit below 1.2 %, with deltas confined to ±0.2 %, indicating negligible leakage.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Content gap is stable (+0.3 pp WoW) and concentrated in long-haul markets.
Parity clearly dominates; no material movement over prior periods.
Average discount only −0.18 %, suggesting limited cannibalisation risk.
Premiums modest at +0.20 %, providing stable price perception.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 95.6 %; only 2.8 % of itineraries missing and price deltas within ±0.2 %.
Coverage is the core issue—half of O&Ds absent—while available itineraries price in line with the site.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity excels at 95.1 %; only 2.8 % missing, though small premium cases rise to 1.78 %.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Premiums double the far-out rate (1.14 % vs 0.57 %) and average +0.24 %—a watch-point for last-minute shoppers.
Best parity (81.4 %) and minimal discounts (0.09 %); offer gap steady at 17.9 %.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE parity improved to 62 %, gaining 0.4 pp WoW and nearly 2 pp MoM.
Share of cheaper fares fell to 13.7 %, but the average discount remains a steep 14–15 %.
For Non-US origins, 42 % of itineraries price 4 % above the site, up 9 pp WoW.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Stable overall, but reaches 50 % on long-haul routes, limiting high-value visibility.
Continues to edge higher, supporting brand integrity.
Discount frequency down, yet depth (≈14 %) still erodes yield, especially close-in.
Premiums modest overall but rising internationally (+1.4 pp WoW).

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 72 %; undercuts 16.6 % (−2.7 pp WoW) at a 14 % discount—scope for tighter day-of-departure control.
50 % content gap dwarfs pricing issues; only 0.2 % overpriced cases.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity 66 %; undercuts 12.8 % (−1.4 pp WoW); almost no premiums.
Overpricing dominates (41.6 % at +4 %); parity has slid to 37 %.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 59 %; undercuts 16.6 % at a 15 % discount—largest dilution zone.
Parity peaks at 68 %; undercuts only 7.6 % at a milder 9 % gap.

gds_highlights.line_content: 81 % price alignment with JetBlue.com, steady over time.
49.7 % of long-haul O&Ds not present in GDS, versus 2.2 % on short-haul.
+24 % premium on 1.1 % of close-in itineraries; far-out premiums fall to +3 %.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Flat WoW; mirrors OTA gap but far higher on long-haul.
Channel leads in consistency across all windows.
Premium averages +20 %, driven by close-in bookings.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 96.4 %; only 2.2 % missing; premiums rare but steep (+21 %).
Parity falls to 49.6 % due to 49.7 % content gap; where present, premiums average 18 %.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 20.3 % missing; premiums on 0.6 % of cases at +26 %; discounts sparse (0.3 %, −17 %).
Parity 93.1 %; only 4.5 % missing; premiums slightly higher frequency (2.2 %) but mild (+9 %).

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: +24 % premium on 1.1 % of itineraries; 81 % parity; 18 % missing.
Availability gap unchanged (18 %), but premiums drop to +3 % on only 0.5 % of searches.
